How to create a qmd from gists

Source: vignettes/new-quarto.Rmd
new-quarto.Rmd
library(bsu.tools)

Borrowing from the rUM package, the new_quarto() function enables you to create a new Quarto qmd file utilizing one of our built in templates.

The function has three arguments:
- filename: the name of your new file. If you forget the .qmd ending the function will automatically add it for you.
- path: where should the file be created. Uses here::here() by default.
- gist: the template you want to use (see below).

As of 2025-12-24 there are currently 3 qmd gists available:
- “no_logo_quarto”,
- “ctsc_quarto”,
- and “hac_quarto”.

Simply call new_quarto(filename = "your-new-qmd", gist = "<one-of-the-three>") in the console to create and open your new qmd file from the template.

Developed by Matthew Ponzini.

Site built with pkgdown 2.2.0.
